abstract: HSBC said the sale of its 15.6 percent stake in Ping An Insurance of China to the Charoen Pokphand Group of Thailand was in keeping with its strategy of cutting costs and bolstering its balance sheet.
snippet: HSBC said the sale of its 15.6 percent stake in Ping An Insurance of China to the Charoen Pokphand Group of Thailand was in keeping with its strategy of cutting costs and bolstering its balance sheet.
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG – HSBC Holdings, one of the biggest banks in Europe, said on Wednesday that it would sell its entire stake in a leading Chinese insurer to a Thai conglomerate for 72.7 billion Hong Kong dollars ($9.4 billion).

headline.main: HSBC Sells Stake in Chinese Insurer for $9.4 Billion
headline.print_headline: HSBC Sells Stake in Chinese Insurer for $9.4 Billion
